channel.title: Ramblings on The poetry of (in)security
channel.description: Recent content in Ramblings on The poetry of (in)security

item.title: Saints and Outlaws
item.description: I have been teaching a class on Network Security at mlab and one student asked what the state of cyber-security in the country was. In this post I explain the current state and the outlook over the coming years.

item.title: Hackers Wanted!
item.description:

item.title: Learning to hack
item.description: Becoming a skilled hacker or the politically correct “information security specialist” doesn’t have a straightforward defined path. Here I will try to layout what constitutes a good way to go about it.

item.title: AfricaHackon - Be part of the story
item.description: I first heard of AfricaHackon at my previous job where I was working in IT. A colleague and friend told me about a conference about information security that would be held at our building. This was early last year. Being in charge of the network, I would be assisting in setting up internet access for the conference. Now when you’re incharge of the network and you hear you’ll be giving access to your network to a room full of the best “hackers” in the country, you get a bit nervous. I use the word “hackers” in quotes because that’s where I’d like to start.
